alert.note: Alert for Central and West Carbon; North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 30 at 2:03AM MDT until September 30 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL WYOMING UNTIL 7 PM SATURDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 7 PM MDT Saturday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 422. Fire weather zone 423. Fire weather zone 427. * WIND...Southwest 20 to 30 MPH with gusts up to 45 MPH. * HUMIDITY...As low as 9 to 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Central and West Carbon; North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County
